meanings.definition: To unravel or solve a mystery or problem.
meanings.sent1: She clewed the puzzle by finding the missing piece.
meanings.sent2: The detective clewed the case and found the culprit.
meanings.sent3: After hours of searching, she finally clewed the mystery and discovered the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: His keen observation skills clewed the solution to the complex problem.
meanings.sent5: The clever detective clewed the mystery with ease.

meanings.definition: To gather or coil up a rope or line.
meanings.sent1: He clewed the rope neatly after docking the boat.
meanings.sent2: The sailor clewed the line to secure the sail in place.
meanings.sent3: She clewed the tangled rope into a perfect coil with skillful hands.
meanings.sent4: The fisherman clewed the fishing net after a successful catch.
meanings.sent5: Clewing the rope tightly, he prepared for the upcoming storm.

meanings.sent1: The teacher clewed the students on how to approach the challenging assignment.

meanings.sent3: She clewed her friends to the best restaurant in town for a delicious meal.
meanings.sent4: His experience clewed him in mentoring the new employees effectively.
meanings.sent5: The wise elder clewed the young couple on the path to a happy marriage.
